question.body: A molecule would best be described as:

multiple_choice.choice: A stable bond between atoms of at least 2 different elements.
A stable bond between 2 atoms of the same element
A charged molecule made up of more than one atom

response.feedback: Incorrect. Although molecules can contain more than 1 element, many, such as oxygen (O2) contain the same element.
Incorrect. Although molecules may be made of more than one atom of the same element (such as O2), many molecules (such as H2O) contain atoms of different elements.
Incorrect. Molecules are neutral, which aids in their stability.
Correct. Molecules are stable bonds between atoms of the same or differing elements.

part.hint: Molecules are commonly found in the environment because these are stable configurations.
